**INSTITUTION
Discharge Summary
Name :
**NAME[AAA , CCC]
Acct # :
**ID-NUM
MRN :
**ID-NUM
Admitted :
**DATE[Jan 16 2008]
Discharged :
**DATE[Jan 19 2008]
Dict :
**NAME[WWW , VVV]
Attend :
**NAME[ZZZ , YYY]
Mr. **NAME[AAA] is a **AGE[in 50s]- year - old male with a known history of coronary artery bypass grafting x 5 in **STREET-ADDRESS .
( _______________ ) at **INSTITUTION .
He presented from **INSTITUTION where he was admitted with chest pain .
He ruled out for myocardial infarction .
stress test was positive for a small reversible anterolateral defect .
He also had a medium - sized fixed inferior defect consistent with infarct and a small area of reversibility in the posterolateral segment suggestive of peri-lateral infarct ischemia .
His ejection fraction was 47% .
Cardiac catheterization by Dr. **NAME[UUU TTT] revealed an ejection fraction of 40% to 50% , left main trunk was short .
LAD
99% proximal , left circumflex 100% , mid RCA 100% , proximal LIMA to LAD , SVG to diagonal , SVG to obtuse marginal 1 and 2 , SVG to PDA were patent and functional .
Medical management was undertaken with this patient .
He was subsequently discharged the following day on :
1. Aspirin 325 q. day .
2. Lipitor 20 q.p.m.
3. Imdur 60 q. day .
4. Lopressor 50 b.i.d.
5. Nitroglycerin p.r.n. for pain .
6. Prevacid 30 q. day .
7. Quinapril 40 mg q.a.m.
He is to follow up with Dr. **NAME[SSS] at **NAME[RRR] Hospital in 2 weeks .
______________________________
**NAME[VVV WWW] , PA-C
HS Job # 820843 / 38373 / 38218
SHY # **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Jan 19 2008] 09:31
T :
**DATE[Jan 20 2008] 17:47
**CARBON-COPY
